node.title: Government backs carbon capture technology despite it being 'three times the cost' of renewables
node.alt: Two men wearing orange vests and blue helments stand in front of a power station
node.description: The Federal Government is relying on carbon capture and storage to help it meet its 2050 emissions targets – a trial proposed on Queensland's Western Downs could decide whether that plan will work.
node.content:
["The Prime Minister Scott Morrison is in Glasgow touting his new 'technology, not taxes' energy policy, a key part of which involves\u00a0rolling out carbon capture and storage\u00a0(CCS).\u00a0", "But whether CCS will ever be deployed at scale in Australia could come down to a\u00a0multi-million dollar project being planned on\u00a0Queensland's Western Downs.", "Work is underway in the Surat Basin in Southern Queensland,\u00a0to determine whether rock formations, deep underground, can store millions of tonnes of carbon dioxide.", "Coal-giant Glencore, through subsidiary CTSco, has committed \u00a0$210 million dollars to a three-year trial, and has applied for approvals from the Queensland Government.", "The company is planning to build a demonstration plant to capture about 110,00 tonnes of carbon each year from the Millmerran Power Station, over 200 kilometres west of Brisbane.", "The CO2\u00a0would then be transported to a storage\u00a0site at Moonie, more than 100km\u00a0away, and\u00a0injected into a deep underground aquifer, where the water is too salty to be viable for farmers. There the CO2 mixes with the water, carbonating it, a process that helps hold it in place.", "", "
The site at Moonie, on Queensland's Western Downs could store more than half a billion tonnes of carbon.(Supplied: LETA)
", "CTSco project manager Darren Greer said\u00a0the project had the potential to be scaled up, and for more than half a billion tonnes of carbon to be stored at Moonie,\u00a0making it one of the biggest onshore CCS projects in Australia.", "Mr Greer said the technology was proven, with more than 65 projects in operation or being built across the world, and that the cost to capture and store carbon was coming down.", "\"When you look at the projects around the world, it comes at a cost of between sort of $60 to $80 a tonne,\" he said.", "\"But the technology, that's the last generation of technology. The new generation of technologies that are emerging now have the ability to more than halve\u00a0that.\"", "", "
CTSCo's Darren Greer is leading the project on Queensland's Western Downs.(ABC News: Nathan Morris)
", "Mr Greer said the project would be a test case for CCS in Australia and it\u00a0could decide whether the technology would be used across the country.", "The Federal Government is investing $20 billion into \"low emissions technologies\" including CCS, and\u00a0the project at Moonie has already received $5 million in federal funding.", "Deputy Nationals Leader David Littleproud said the Government's investment in CCS would save jobs in the coal industry.\u00a0", "\"This is an investment\u00a0in particularly those areas like Maranoa that are heavy in resources and in energy production,\" Mr Littleproud said.", "\"We're saying to not only Australia, but to the world that this technology can reduce our emissions, which will mean not only do we keep those jobs here, but also jobs in our coal gas will continue.\"", "", "
Engineers examine rock samples taken from the CTSCo site at Moonie.(Supplied: LETA)
", "Mr Littleproud said other countries including Japan and the United States were investing in CSS as well.", "\"[In Japan]\u00a0coal is being burned, the carbon is being captured and it's also being mixed with ammonia, to make it cheaper and quicker and easier to transport,\" he said.", "\"Very encouraging signs around this technology plus the fact that the Biden administration is also investing real money into this technology.\"", "
Fossil fuel industry 'impossible to decarbonise'
", "Despite the positive messaging from CCS proponents, the Climate Council's Greg Bourne says that many CCS projects around the world are actually used to enhance the production of oil and gas.", "\"There are 28 major projects around the world, but every single one of them\u00a0\u2014\u00a0every single one of them\u00a0\u2014\u00a0is basically tied into what\u2019s known as enhanced oil recovery, or the production of liquefied natural gas,\" he\u00a0said.", "", "
Millmerran power station, west of Brisbane, is set to be the site of a carbon capture demonstration site.(ABC News: Nathan Morris)
", "Mr Bourne is a former BP engineer, and said while CCS could play a role in helping reduce emissions from industries such as cement production and steel making,\u00a0saying the technology could save the gas and coal industry was a \"false hope\".", "\"When you do the numbers \u2026 you find very, very quickly that it's just impossible to decarbonise the fossil fuel industry in any way, shape, or form.\"", "Mr Bourne said the Federal Government should instead be focusing on natural advantages such as solar and wind.", "\"[We have]\u00a0more sun and more wind than you can poke a stick at [and]\u00a0we will harness that.\"", "
CCS 'three times the cost' of renewables
", "Energy finance analyst Bruce Robertson, from the Institute for\u00a0Energy\u00a0Economics and Financial Analysis (IEEFA), said using CCS on a coal plant was \"horrendously expensive.\"", "\u201cIf we\u2019re talking a coal fired power station:\u00a0According to the CSIRO, a coal-fired power\u00a0station\u00a0in 2030 should cost around $102\u00a0a\u00a0megawatt-hour,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"If you add carbon\u00a0captured\u00a0and storage it goes up to $186 a megawatt-hour.\u00a0", "Former Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull went further, recently describing\u00a0CCS as\u00a0'a con' and a 'proven failure' at an energy conference.", "\"It is being used by the fossil fuel sector as a distraction to delay the end of burning coal and gas,\" Mr Turnbull said.", "\"Now, to take this con on, we've established the green hydrogen organization, which I'm chairman, it will be and is now a global advocate for green hydrogen as the only colour hydrogen that is genuinely clean.\"", "For CTSCo project manager Darren Greer, the project will just be one of many strategies used to help Australia meet its 2050 net-zero target.", "\"I think the ability to emit CO2 unabated, those days numbered.\""]
